greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of strict partitions of n with constant (equal) first-quotients.
comment: Also the number of reversed strict partitions of n with constant (equal) first-quotients.
The first quotients of a sequence are defined as if the sequence were an increasing divisor chain, so for example the quotients of (6,3,1) are (1/2,1/3).
link: Gus Wiseman, Sequences counting and ranking integer partitions by the differences of their successive parts.
Gus Wiseman, Sequences counting and ranking partitions and compositions by their differences and quotients.
example: 1   2   3    4    5    6    7     8    9    A    B    C    D     E     F
xref: The version for differences instead of quotients is A049980.
The non-strict ordered version is A342495.
The distinct instead of equal version is A342520.
A001055 counts factorizations (strict: A045778, ordered: A074206).
A003238 counts chains of divisors summing to n - 1 (strict: A122651).
A154402 counts partitions with adjacent parts x = 2y.
A167865 counts strict chains of divisors > 1 summing to n.
A175342 counts compositions with equal differences.
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Mar 19 2021
